result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Deford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be in pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. No pretrial incarceration credit.- Stayed

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
No contact, direct or indirect, with victims S.M.O. and H.P.E.

May be served on Shawano County.
Submit letter of apology within the first 30 days of probation. Letters are to be given to agent first before forwarding to victims.
Engage  with other counseling and assessments deemed appropriate and as recommended by the agent.
May get early discharge from probation if Defendant is in full compliance and the agent recommends it.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Deford

defendant.name: Deford, David J.
defendant.address: 1402 E Royalton Street, c/o Waupaca Co Jail, Waupaca, WI 54981

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J. Deford in court, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Britteny Mae LaFond appeared by phone for Defendant David J. Deford. 

11:35 AM Court calls case.
Atty Mukoski states appearances.

Court reviews the file. 
Court imposed and stayed a 300 day jail sentence. Defendant was given probation. Probation was revoked. Court, at the time of imposing sentence, granted huber for employment and counseling.
Defendant is now serving the 300 days. Since that time, the Court received a letter from Defendant's wife, asking for child care. Defendant sent a similiar letter asking for child care privileges.

Court went back through the complaint and requested today's hearing.
Court talked to the probation department about an hour ago. The agent is not in favor of this request. 
Court questions counsel as to who the children are.

Atty LaFond addresses the Court. 

Defendant has two children,  one by marriage (5 years old) and one by genetics (4 years old).

Court questions Defendant for further clarifications. Defendant replies.

Request here is to get out on huber to watch his step-child.

Atty Mukoski addresses the Court, objects to the request.
Atty LaFond does not wish to reply.
Defendant addresses the Court, had a job over huber. 

Court states the facts for the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not allow huber privileges for child care.
Huber privileges for employment and counseling is what was ordered and will remain in effect.
from Defendant dated 12-05-2018
Hearing on January 18, 2019 at 11:15 am.

from Defendant's wife
Letter to Branch 3 Judge dated 11/05/18 in re:  request for modification of JOC to allow the defendant to have huber priviliges for employment, counseling and childcare purposes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J. Deford in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:35 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is set today for a sentencing.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Pleas have been entered previously.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, gives sentencing recommendations.
Atty Boden addresses the Court, gives sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant works on two farms.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 300 Days, No pretrial incarceration credit, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be in
Probation for a period of 24 Months
May be served on Shawano County
Conditions:
No contact, direct or indirect, with victims S.M.O. and H.P.E.
Submit letter of apology within the first 30 days of probation. Letters are to be given to agent first before forwarding to victims.
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Engage  with other counseling and assessments deemed appropriate and as recommended by the agent
May get early discharge from probation if Defendant is in full compliance and the agent recommends it
Pay costs

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 300 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be in
Concurrent to Count 1
Probation for a period of 24 Months
May be served on Shawano County
Concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

No pretrial incarceration credit
May get early discharge from probation if Defendant is in full compliance and the agent recommends it
20 days in which to appeal the case
filed by Atty Andrew Boden

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 10, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant David J. Deford in court with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM323 & 15CT320.

9:46 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM323:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest 

15CT320:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification; no victim's appear in Court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 15CM323 and Count 1 of 15CT320 is DRI.  

BY THE COURT:
Sentencing to be held at a later date. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing on November 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David J. Deford in court with attorney Nicholas R Abts. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard:  15CM323, 15CT320
11:36 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court questions Atty Abts re: motion to withdraw. 
Atty Abts makes statements to the Court.  Will forward a signed order to the Public Defender.  
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant responds. 
Atty Abts makes additional statements to the Court. 
Court questions defendant further. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Abts further. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Defendant makes additional statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court signs the order.  Defendant and Atty Abts to go to the Public Defender today to submit the order and get the name of his new attorney.  And the defendant is to cooperate with his new attorney.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
